name: AI Agent API
description:
AI agent with tool calling and conversation memory, built with the Vercel AI SDK and
  Amazon Bedrock (Claude).
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda with
  Lambda URL and response streaming.
Conversation history is persisted in DynamoDB so the agent
  remembers context across requests.

name: AI Chatbot
description:
AI chatbot with real-time streaming responses, built with the Vercel AI SDK and
  Amazon Bedrock (Claude).
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda with
  Lambda URL and response streaming
  enabled. Responses stream token-by-token to the browser.
Includes a minimal web UI for testing. Pay only for requests you receive.

name: Astro Serverless
description:
Server-side rendered Astro application deployed serverlessly.
Uses the purpose-built Astro web resource that runs the
  app in AWS Lambda with static assets on CloudFront CDN. Zero infrastructure configuration needed.

name: Astro.js SSR
description:
simple Server-side rendered Astro.js application.
The project uses a Web Service to run the Astro.js container.

name: Astro.js static
description:
statically-built Astro.js application.
The project uses a S3 storage bucket to store the application assets
  and a CDN to cache the content at the edge.

name: Express.js API with Postgres
description:
simple HTTP API built using Express.js.
The application runs in a web service resource and uses
  a Postgres relational database to store the data. To
  simplify the database access, this project uses Prisma.

name: FastAPI with Postgres
description:
HTTP API built with FastAPI, the modern Python web framework.
Runs as an ASGI web service with a Postgres
  relational database. Uses SQLAlchemy for database access
  and uv for dependency management.

name: Next.js with Drizzle & Postgres
description:
Full-stack Next.js app with Drizzle ORM and
  PostgreSQL.
Deployed serverlessly via the nextjs-web resource —
  Lambda + S3 + CloudFront CDN. Pay only for traffic you serve.
Includes database schema, migrations, and a working CRUD example with Server Actions.

name: Fullstack Todo App
description:
Full-stack todo app with a vanilla JS frontend (S3 + CloudFront) and a serverless API (Lambda + DynamoDB).
No build step required. The API URL is automatically injected into the frontend at deploy time.

name: Hono API
description:
Lightweight HTTP API built with Hono, an ultrafast web framework.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda behind an
  HTTP API Gateway. Pay only for requests you receive.

name: MCP Server
description:
A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for AI agents and LLMs.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda with
  Lambda URL and response streaming
  enabled. Pay only for requests you receive.
Uses the
  Streamable HTTP transport
  for compatibility with any MCP client.

name: n8n Self-Hosted
description:
Self-hosted n8n workflow automation platform on AWS.
Runs as a web service using the official n8n Docker
  image with a PostgreSQL database for persistence.
Build AI agents, automate workflows, and connect 400+ integrations — all on your own infrastructure.

name: Next.js app using container
description:
simple Server-side rendered Next.js application.
The project uses a Web Service to run the Next app.

name: Next.js SaaS with Auth & Postgres
description:
Full-stack SaaS starter built with Next.js, Prisma, and
  Cognito authentication.
Deployed serverlessly using the nextjs-web resource with a
  PostgreSQL database and user authentication pool.
Includes database migrations via deploy hooks and a working CRUD API example.

name: Next.js Serverless (OpenNext)
description:
Next.js app deployed serverlessly via the
  nextjs-web resource — Lambda + S3 + CloudFront CDN.
Zero-config deployment. Includes a server-rendered page and an API route example.
Optionally add a database — see commented section in stacktape.yml.

name: Nuxt Serverless
description:
Server-side rendered Nuxt application deployed serverlessly.
Uses the purpose-built Nuxt web resource that runs the
  app in AWS Lambda with static assets on CloudFront CDN. Zero infrastructure configuration needed.

name: RAG API
description:
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) API for question answering over your documents.
Uses Amazon Bedrock for embeddings and LLM responses, with
  DynamoDB for vector storage and
  S3 for document uploads.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda. Upload documents,
  then ask questions — the API retrieves relevant context and generates answers.

name: SvelteKit Serverless
description:
Server-side rendered SvelteKit application deployed serverlessly.
Uses the purpose-built SvelteKit web resource that
  runs the app in AWS Lambda with static assets on CloudFront CDN. Zero infrastructure configuration needed.

name: API with Authentication
description:
JWT-protected API with Cognito authentication, including
  hosted sign-up/sign-in UI.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda behind an
  HTTP API Gateway with a Cognito JWT authorizer.
Includes public and protected endpoints with automatic JWT validation.

name: Cron Job
description:
Scheduled Lambda function that runs on a cron
  schedule.
Perfect for recurring background tasks like sending emails, cleaning up data, generating reports, or syncing services.

name: Django API with Postgres
description:
simple HTTP API built using Django and
  Django REST Framework.
The application runs in a web service resource and uses
  a Postgres relational database to store the data.

name: Self-Hosted App (Docker)
description:
Deploy any Docker image as a web service on AWS.
Perfect for self-hosting tools like Uptime Kuma, Plausible, Metabase, n8n, or your own Docker containers.
Includes optional PostgreSQL database — uncomment to
  enable.

name: .NET Web API with Postgres
description:
HTTP API built with ASP.NET Core (.NET 9).
Runs in a Docker web service with a Postgres
  relational database. Uses Entity Framework Core for
  database access.

name: Event-Driven Pipeline
description:
Event-driven order processing pipeline using SQS,
  EventBridge, and
  Step Functions.
Demonstrates reliable message processing with FIFO ordering, dead-letter queues, event routing, and workflow
  orchestration.
Runs serverlessly — pay only for events you process.

name: Express.js API with MongoDb
description:
Simple Webservice-based HTTP API.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses
  MongoDb Atlas cluster to store the data. To
  simplify the database access, this project uses Mongoose ORM.

name: File Upload API
description:
File upload and management API using S3 presigned URLs.
Supports uploading, listing, downloading, and deleting files. Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda.

name: Flask API with Postgres
description:
simple HTTP API built using Flask.
The application runs in a web service resource and uses
  a Postgres relational database to store the data.

name: Gin API with Postgres
description:
simple HTTP API built using Gin framework.
The application runs in a web service resource and uses
  a Postgres relational database to store the data. To
  simplify the database access, this project uses go-gin.

name: GraphQL API
description:
GraphQL API built with graphql-yoga and DynamoDB storage.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda behind an HTTP API Gateway. Pay only for requests you receive.

name: Lambda API with DynamoDB
description:
Serverless REST API with DynamoDB storage using
  Hono as the HTTP router.
Runs in a single Lambda function behind an
  HTTP API Gateway. Pay only for requests you receive.

name: Lambda API with MongoDb
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP API.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses
  MongoDb Atlas cluster to store the data. To
  simplify the database access, this project uses Mongoose ORM.

name: Typescript monorepo with pnpm
description: This example demonstrates how to use Stacktape with a pnpm monorepo

name: Multi-Step Workflow
description:
Multi-step data processing workflow using AWS Step Functions.
Demonstrates validation, branching, retries, and error handling. Trigger via HTTP and check execution status.

name: Nest.js API with Postgres
description:
simple HTTP API built using Nest.js.
The application runs in a web service resource and uses
  a Postgres relational database to store the data. To
  simplify the database access, this project uses Prisma.

name: Open WebUI (Self-Hosted)
description:
Self-hosted Open WebUI — an open-source ChatGPT/Claude alternative UI.
Runs as a web service using the official Docker image.
Connect to OpenAI, Anthropic, Amazon Bedrock, or any OpenAI-compatible API. Supports multi-user auth, RAG, and more.

name: Phoenix API with Postgres
description:
HTTP API built with Phoenix, the Elixir web framework.
Runs in a Docker web service with a Postgres
  relational database. Uses Ecto for database access.

name: Queue Worker
description:
Background job processing with SQS queue and
  Lambda consumer.
Includes an HTTP API to enqueue jobs and a worker function that processes them. Supports batch processing with
  per-message error handling.

name: Remix Serverless
description:
Remix app deployed serverlessly via the
  remix-web resource — Lambda + S3 + CloudFront CDN.
Server-side rendered with nested routing and progressive enhancement. Pay only for traffic you serve.

name: Remix website container
description:
simple Server-side rendered Remix application.
The project uses a Web Service to run the Remix app.

name: Rust Lambda API
description:
HTTP API built with Rust using the AWS Lambda Rust Runtime.
Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda with minimal cold
  starts and extremely low memory usage. Requires cargo-lambda for building.

name: SolidStart Serverless
description:
SolidStart app deployed serverlessly via the
  solidstart-web resource — Lambda + S3 + CloudFront
  CDN.
Server-side rendered with fine-grained reactivity. Pay only for traffic you serve.

name: TanStack Start Serverless
description:
TanStack Start app deployed serverlessly via the
  tanstack-web resource — Lambda + S3 + CloudFront CDN.
Server-side rendered with full-stack type safety. Pay only for traffic you serve.

name: Telegram Bot
description:
Telegram bot running serverlessly in
  AWS Lambda with
  Lambda URL.
Uses Telegram's webhook mode — no polling needed. Lambda is invoked only when messages arrive.
Pay only for messages your bot processes. Zero cost when idle.

name: URL Shortener
description:
URL shortener service with click tracking, built with Hono and DynamoDB.
Create short links, redirect visitors, and track click counts. Runs serverlessly in AWS Lambda.

name: Webhook Ingestion
description:
Reliable webhook receiver with async processing using
  Lambda and
  SQS.
Accepts webhooks immediately (fast 200 response), then processes them asynchronously via a queue. Prevents timeouts
  and ensures no events are lost.
Perfect for receiving Stripe, GitHub, Shopify, or any third-party webhooks.

name: Discord Bot
description:
Discord bot running as a
  worker service on AWS.
Uses discord.js with a persistent WebSocket connection to Discord's gateway.
Always-on container — ideal for real-time bot interactions, slash commands, and event handling.

name: Go lambda with DynamoDB
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP API using Go runtime.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses
  DynamoDb to store the data.

name: GPU Batch Inference
description:
GPU-accelerated batch inference using batch jobs with
  NVIDIA GPUs.
Upload data to S3, trigger an inference job, and get results. Uses spot instances for up to 90% cost savings.
Perfect for ML inference, image processing, video transcoding, or any GPU-intensive workload.

name: Java lambda with DynamoDB
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP API using Java runtime.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses
  DynamoDb to store the data.

name: Lambda API with MySQL
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP API.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses a
  MySQL relational database to store the data. To simplify
  the database access, this project uses Prisma.

name: Lambda app with Redis
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP endpoint that stores data in
  ElastiCache Redis.

name: Web scraper with Puppeteer
description:
web link scraper implemented in Typescript using headless chrome -
  Puppeteer.
The scraper runs in a Lambda function

name: Python Lambda with MongoDb
description:
simple Lambda-based HTTP API using Python runtime.
The application runs in a Lambda function and uses
  DynamoDb to store the data. To simplify
  the database access, this project uses PyMongo.

name: React SPA
description:
Single-page application built with React and Vite.
Hosted on S3 with CloudFront CDN for global delivery.
Supports environment injection at deploy time via window.STPINJECTEDENV — no rebuild needed to change config.

name: Websocket API with Socket.io
description:
WebSocket API built with Socket.io and scaled across multiple containers.
Uses a Redis cluster for session synchronization between
  container instances, with an
  Application Load Balancer for connection routing.
Runs in a multi-container workload with
  automatic scaling.

name: GPU Batch Job (TensorFlow)
description:
GPU-capable batch job for image classification using
  TensorFlow.
Upload a .zip of images to the input S3 bucket — the job automatically classifies them using a pre-trained
  EfficientNet model and saves results to the output bucket.
Uses spot instances for up to 90% cost
  savings. Perfect as a starting point for any ML batch processing workload.
